title: Severe Acute Pancreatitis
diagnosis_topic: Systemic inflammatory response to pancreatic injury often secondary to alcohol or gallstones
setup_script: A 45-year-old man with a history of heavy alcohol use presents with severe epigastric pain radiating to the back. He has vomiting and appears febrile.

dynamic_flow.reply: BP 100/60 mmHg, HR 120 bpm, RR 24/min, Temp 38.5 C.
Pain started suddenly, worsens after meals and radiates to the back; denies gallstones; drinks six beers daily.
Serum lipase 1,200 U/L, amylase elevated, WBC 18 K/uL, BUN 25 mg/dL; calcium low at 7.5 mg/dL.
Ranson score 4 (predicting severe disease) or BISAP score 3; consider ICU admission.
Early CT may not show necrosis; used if diagnosis uncertain or patient not improving; CT at 72 hours shows necrosis of pancreatic body.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident initiates aggressive isotonic fluid resuscitation and pain control
dynamic_flow.reply: 250 mL/hr lactated Ringer's; opioids administered; patient kept NPO.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident begins enteral nutrition via nasojejunal tube within 48 hours
dynamic_flow.reply: Helps maintain gut integrity and decreases infection; parenteral nutrition reserved if enteral not tolerated.
Not indicated unless evidence of infected necrosis or cholangitis.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If patient develops organ failure or infected necrosis
dynamic_flow.reply: Broad-spectrum antibiotics and percutaneous drainage; surgical necrosectomy deferred until walling off (4 weeks).
Hypovolemia may lead to necrosis and multi-organ failure.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident addresses alcohol cessation and counseling
dynamic_flow.reply: Referral to addiction services to prevent recurrence.
Pseudocyst formation, pancreatic ascites and chronic pancreatitis; manage accordingly.

critical_decision_points: Recognition of severe pancreatitis and use of scoring systems
Early aggressive fluid resuscitation and pain management
Appropriate use of imaging and timing of interventions
Avoidance of prophylactic antibiotics and timing of necrosectomy
Long-term management including nutrition and alcohol cessation
